for_embeddings: Can I share my account with a friend or family member?
content: Can I share my account with a friend or family member? --- No, sharing your account with anyone, including friends or family members, is not permitted.

for_embeddings: Can my friends trade my account?
content: Can my friends trade my account? --- Sorry,  your account is for your personal use only. It's not allowed to share access with friends or family.

for_embeddings: Is it okay to let a friend or family member use my account?
content: Is it okay to let a friend or family member use my account? --- No, you can’t share your trading account with anyone—not even friends or family. Only you, the registered owner, are allowed to use it.

for_embeddings: What would happen if I let my friend borrow my trading account for just one day?
content: What would happen if I let my friend borrow my trading account for just one day? --- Sharing your trading account, even for a single day, is not permitted.  You’d also be fully accountable for any losses or unauthorized actions that occur during that time.

for_embeddings: If I share my account with a friend and they lose money, who’s responsible?
content: If I share my account with a friend and they lose money, who’s responsible? --- Sharing your account is strictly forbidden. If your friend trades and loses money, you, as the registered account owner, are solely responsible for those losses.

for_embeddings: What are the risks if I give my account to a friend to trade while I’m on vacation?
content: What are the risks if I give my account to a friend to trade while I’m on vacation? --- It’s against the rules to share your trading account, even temporarily. If your friend trades while you’re away, you could face account suspension or other disciplinary actions. You’d also bear full responsibility for any financial losses or issues that result, regardless of your absence.

for_embeddings: Could I get in trouble if my friend uses my trading account without my permission?
content: Could I get in trouble if my friend uses my trading account without my permission? --- Yes, if your friend accesses and trades on your account. It’s your responsibility to keep your account secure and not share access.

for_embeddings: What happens if I share my account with a friend and they make a profit?
content: What happens if I share my account with a friend and they make a profit? --- Sharing your account is prohibited, regardless of the outcome.

content: What should I do if I lose access to my registered phone or email? --- If you can’t use the phone number or email you signed up with, get in touch with support@beemarkets.com right away. Their security team will guide you through recovering your account after confirming your identity.

for_embeddings: What should I do if my documents are not approved during the KYC process?
content: What should I do if my documents are not approved during the KYC process? --- If your KYC documents are rejected, we will notify you via email with the reason for the rejection. Please resubmit the corrected documents promptly. You can only deposit funds and trade after successful verification.

for_embeddings: What happens if my KYC documents are rejected?
content: What happens if my KYC documents are rejected? --- Documents may be rejected for various reasons, such as inconsistency, non-compliance, forgery, or expiration. We will email you the specific reason for rejection. Please correct and resubmit the documents accordingly.

for_embeddings: Why were my documents not approved for KYC?
content: Why were my documents not approved for KYC? --- Documents may be rejected for various reasons, such as inconsistency, non-compliance, forgery, or expiration. We will email you the specific reason for rejection. Please correct and resubmit the documents accordingly.

for_embeddings: Can I still trade if my documents are pending verification?
content: Can I still trade if my documents are pending verification? --- No, you cannot trade or deposit funds until your documents are verified. Please complete the KYC process to gain full account access.

for_embeddings: How long does the KYC verification process take?
content: How long does the KYC verification process take? --- Verification is usually completed within a few minutes and no later than 48 hours. You will receive an email with the result.

for_embeddings: How can I change my password?
content:
How can I change my password? --- Answer: It depends on what password you’re resetting:
Login Password: Go to the BeeMarkets login page, hit “Forgot Password,” and follow the steps.
MetaTrader 5 Password: Log into the BeeMarkets site, head to Account Management, then Account Settings, and pick “Change Password” or “Reset Password.” Or do it straight in the MetaTrader 5 app.
FastBull/CloudTrader4 Password: These only have a read-only password, and you reset it the same way as MetaTrader 5.

for_embeddings: What should I do if I think someone has accessed my account and I need to change my password urgently?
content:
What should I do if I think someone has accessed my account and I need to change my password urgently? --- If you suspect unauthorized access, act quickly to secure your account by changing your password:

Login Password: Visit the BeeMarkets login page, click "Forgot Password," and follow the steps to reset it.
MetaTrader 5 Password: Log into the BeeMarkets site, go to Account Management > Account Settings, and select "Change Password." Alternatively, reset it directly in the MetaTrader 5 app.
FastBull/CloudTrader4 Password: These use read-only passwords; reset them the same way as MetaTrader 5—via the BeeMarkets site or app.
After resetting, check your account for suspicious activity and email support@beemarkets.com if you need further help.

for_embeddings: I've forgotten my password. How can I reset it?
content:
I've forgotten my password. How can I reset it? --- If you’ve forgotten your password, here’s how to reset it based on the type:

Login Password: Go to the BeeMarkets login page, select "Forgot Password," and follow the reset instructions.
MetaTrader 5 Password: Log into the BeeMarkets site, navigate to Account Management > Account Settings, and choose "Reset Password." You can also reset it within the MetaTrader 5 app.
FastBull/CloudTrader4 Password: These have read-only passwords; use the same reset process as MetaTrader 5.
Follow the prompts carefully to regain access.

for_embeddings: I want to update my password regularly for security purposes. How can I do that?
content:
I want to update my password regularly for security purposes. How can I do that? --- Updating your password regularly is a smart security habit. Here’s how:

Login Password: Head to the BeeMarkets login page and use "Forgot Password" to reset it, even if you know your current password.
MetaTrader 5 Password: Log into the BeeMarkets site, go to Account Management > Account Settings, and select "Change Password." You can also update it in the MetaTrader 5 app.
FastBull/CloudTrader4 Password: For these read-only passwords, follow the same steps as MetaTrader 5.
Set a schedule to keep your account secure over time.

for_embeddings: I'm new to BeeMarkets. How do I set up my password for the first time?
content:
I'm new to BeeMarkets. How do I set up my password for the first time? --- As a new BeeMarkets user, you’ll set your passwords during onboarding:

Login Password: After registering, follow the instructions sent to create your initial login password.
MetaTrader 5, FastBull, or CloudTrader4 Passwords: These trading or read-only passwords are set when you open your trading account.
To change them later:
Use "Forgot Password" on the login page for the login password.
For trading platforms, log into the BeeMarkets site or app to update the password.

for_embeddings: I'm trying to change my password, but I'm encountering errors. What should I do?
content:
I'm trying to change my password, but I'm encountering errors. What should I do? --- If you’re hitting errors while changing your password, troubleshoot with these steps:

Login Password: Try a different browser or clear your cache, then use "Forgot Password" on the BeeMarkets login page.
MetaTrader 5 or FastBull/CloudTrader4 Password: Ensure the app is updated, then retry via the BeeMarkets site (Account Management > Account Settings > Change Password) or the app.
Still Stuck? Contact support@beemarkets.com for help. Check your internet connection and confirm you’re entering the correct current password if required.

for_embeddings: What ID do I need to open an account?
content: What ID do I need to open an account? --- You’ll need a color copy of a valid government ID—like a passport (good for at least 6 months), driver’s license, or national ID card. It should clearly show your full name, birth date and place (or tax ID), issue and expiry dates, and your signature.

for_embeddings: what kind of identification documents are required?
content: what kind of identification documents are required? --- To verify your identity, BeeMarkets will need a color copy of a currently valid government-issued ID. This could be a passport (with at least six months of validity remaining), a driver's license, or a national ID card. Make sure the copy clearly displays your full name, date and place of birth (or tax ID number), the issue and expiry dates of the ID, and your signature.

The document needs to clearly show your complete name, birth date and place (or your tax ID), the date it was issued, its expiration date, and your signature

for_embeddings: Why do I enable Google Authentication for my account?
content: Why do I enable Google Authentication for my account? ---  To enhance the security of your account, you can enable Google Authentication through the Security Settings section in your personal center. It is recommended to store the backup code in a secure location.

for_embeddings: What are the steps to set up Google Authentication for my account?
content: What are the steps to set up Google Authentication for my account? --- To set up Google Authentication and enhance the security of your account, follow these steps: 1. Download and install Google Authenticator from your app store. 2. Open the app and either select "Enter Key" or scan the QR code provided to create your account. 3. After successful setup, you will receive a 6-digit verification code. Enter this code on the verification page to complete the process. Note: Make sure to store your backup code in a secure location. If you lose access to your phone, the backup code will allow you to recover your authenticator. Otherwise, please contact our customer service for assistance in resetting your authenticator.

for_embeddings: What is an Islamic account?
content: What is an Islamic account? --- An Islamic account is a swap-free trading account designed for Muslim traders, in compliance with the Islamic prohibition of Riba (interest). BeeMarkets respects religious beliefs and offers a trading environment that aligns with Sharia principles.

for_embeddings: Could you explain what an Islamic trading account is and who it is designed for?
content: Could you explain what an Islamic trading account is and who it is designed for? --- An Islamic account is a swap-free trading account specifically created for Muslim traders. It adheres to the Islamic principle of prohibiting Riba (interest). BeeMarkets offers these accounts to respect the religious beliefs of our clients and provide a trading environment consistent with Sharia law.

for_embeddings: What are the key features of an Islamic account offered by BeeMarkets, and how does it differ from a standard trading account?
content: What are the key features of an Islamic account offered by BeeMarkets, and how does it differ from a standard trading account? --- An Islamic account offered by BeeMarkets is characterized by being swap-free, meaning it does not incur or pay interest on overnight positions. This is to comply with the Islamic finance principle that forbids Riba (interest). BeeMarkets provides these accounts to cater to Muslim traders who require a trading environment that aligns with Sharia principles.

for_embeddings: When will a dormant fee be applied to my account?
content: When will a dormant fee be applied to my account? ---  If there is no activity (including trading, deposits, withdrawals, or internal transfers) for 180 consecutive days, the account will be considered dormant, and a $10 monthly fee will be charged. If the account balance is below $10, the full balance will be deducted; no fee will be charged if the balance is zero.

content: Under what circumstances does BeeMarkets classify an account as dormant and apply a fee? --- BeeMarkets considers an account dormant if there has been no activity whatsoever (including trading, deposits, withdrawals, or internal transfers) for a continuous period of 180 days. Once classified as dormant, a $10 monthly fee will be applied. If your account balance is less than $10, the entire balance will be deducted. If the balance is zero, no fee will be charged.

After closure, you will lose login access, and your account information will be stored according to regulatory requirements. To resume trading, you will need to apply for a new account.

for_embeddings: What is the difference between a demo account and a live account?
content: What is the difference between a demo account and a live account? ---  A demo account provides a risk-free trading environment using virtual funds, allowing you to test trading strategies and familiarize yourself with the platform. A live account, on the other hand, connects you to real financial markets where actual funds are used for trading. While demo accounts offer the same features and functionality as live accounts, there are key differences that may cause demo performance to differ from real trading results: - Liquidity conditions: Demo accounts may not fully replicate the liquidity of real markets. - Execution environment: Order execution speed and pricing in demo mode can differ from live trading conditions. - Psychological factors: Trading with real money involves financial risk, which can affect decision-making under pressure. You should carefully consider these differences and avoid relying solely on demo results when evaluating your trading performance.

for_embeddings: Could you explain the fundamental differences between a demo trading account and a live trading account offered by BeeMarkets?
content: Could you explain the fundamental differences between a demo trading account and a live trading account offered by BeeMarkets? --- A demo account offers a risk-free environment where you can practice trading using virtual funds to test strategies and get comfortable with the platform's features. In contrast, a live account connects you to the real financial markets, and all trading involves actual capital. While demo accounts mimic live accounts in terms of features, differences in liquidity, order execution, and the absence of psychological pressures associated with real money can lead to varied trading outcomes. Therefore, demo results should not be the sole basis for evaluating your trading potential.

for_embeddings: What are the key distinctions between using a demo account and a live account for trading on the BeeMarkets platform?
content: What are the key distinctions between using a demo account and a live account for trading on the BeeMarkets platform? --- The primary difference is that a demo account uses virtual money in a simulated environment, allowing you to experiment without financial risk and learn the platform. A live account, however, involves trading with real money in the actual markets. Although demo accounts aim to replicate live trading, factors such as liquidity, execution speeds, and the lack of real financial risk in demo trading can cause performance disparities. It's important to be aware of these distinctions when assessing your trading skills.

content: For someone new to trading, what are the main advantages and disadvantages of starting with a demo account versus jumping straight into a live account with BeeMarkets? --- A demo account is advantageous for beginners as it provides a risk-free space to learn the platform and test strategies with virtual funds. A live account, on the other hand, involves real financial risk and connects you directly to the market. While demo accounts offer similar functionalities, the liquidity, execution, and psychological impact of real money are not fully replicated, meaning demo performance may not accurately reflect live trading results. It's crucial to understand these limitations.

for_embeddings: How to make a deposit on BeeMarkets?
content: How to make a deposit on BeeMarkets? ---  Follow these simple steps to complete your deposit: - Log in to your BeeMarkets account and go to the Deposit page. - Choose crypto deposit or fiat deposit. - Select the live trading account you wish to fund. - Enter your deposit amount, deposit currency, payment currency, and country etc. - Choose your preferred payment method (e.g., bank transfer, e-wallet, or cryptocurrency). - Click Confirm, follow the on-screen instructions, and enter your email address as required. - Once the deposit is successfully processed, the funds will be credited to your account and you can start trading.

for_embeddings: What is the process for depositing funds into my BeeMarkets trading account?
content: What is the process for depositing funds into my BeeMarkets trading account? --- To deposit funds, first log in to your BeeMarkets account and navigate to the Deposit page. Next, choose between a crypto or fiat deposit. Then, select the specific live trading account you want to fund. Enter the amount you wish to deposit, along with the deposit currency, payment currency, and your country. Choose your preferred payment method (such as bank transfer, e-wallet, or cryptocurrency). Click "Confirm", follow the on-screen instructions, and enter your email address if prompted. Once the deposit is successfully processed, the funds will be added to your account, and you can begin trading.

Bank card deposits: Typically credited within 3 business days. International wire transfers: Expected to arrive within 3–5 business days. If your deposit has not been credited after a long time, please contact our support team at support@beemarkets.com for assistance.

for_embeddings: Why was my withdrawal request rejected?
content: Why was my withdrawal request rejected? --- Your withdrawal request may have been rejected for one of the following reasons: 1. Insufficient balance in your trading account 2. Not enough available margin to cover open positions 3. Failure to provide required supplementary information or documentation 4. Suspicious fund source or trading activity detected 5. Non-compliant withdrawal method — withdrawals are only allowed to bank accounts or e-wallets under the same name as the account holder 6. Other Or you can provide your account ID to ask reasons from customer support.

Suspicious activity regarding the fund source or your trading may have been detected. 5. You may have used a non-compliant withdrawal method (withdrawals must go to accounts under the same name). 6. for_embeddings: What should I do if I entered the wrong bank account number or cryptocurrency address for a withdrawal?
content: What should I do if I entered the wrong bank account number or cryptocurrency address for a withdrawal? ---  If you enter the wrong number, please take the following measures immediately: Please contact BeeMarkets customer service immediately via support@beemarkets.com, and provide detailed information of your withdrawal application, including submission time, amount, incorrect bank card number or wallet address, etc. We will do our best to assist you in checking the status of fund processing. If the funds have not been processed, we may have the opportunity to cancel or change the request; but once the funds are successfully sent, we will not be able to recover or change the payment information, especially cryptocurrency withdrawals, which will be irreversible once they are on the chain. Prevention advice: Please be sure to repeatedly check the accuracy of the payment information before each withdrawal, especially the encrypted wallet address, to avoid irreparable losses due to operational errors.

for_embeddings: I accidentally entered the wrong bank account number or cryptocurrency address when submitting a withdrawal. What should I do now?
content: I accidentally entered the wrong bank account number or cryptocurrency address when submitting a withdrawal. What should I do now? --- If you've entered incorrect withdrawal details, please immediately contact BeeMarkets customer service at support@beemarkets.com. Provide them with detailed information about your withdrawal request, including the time you submitted it, the amount, and the incorrect bank card number or wallet address you entered. We will do our best to check the processing status. If the withdrawal hasn't been processed yet, we might be able to cancel or modify the request. However, once funds are sent, especially cryptocurrency withdrawals which are irreversible on the blockchain, we won't be able to recover or change the payment information. Important: Always double-check your payment details before submitting a withdrawal to prevent irreversible errors.

for_embeddings: What is a SWIFT Code?
content: What is a SWIFT Code? --- A SWIFT Code (also known as a Bank Identifier Code - BIC) is a unique identifier used to recognize specific banks and financial institutions during international transactions. It is often referred to as a bank’s "ID number." Originally called the Bank Identifier Code (BIC), the term SWIFT Code became more commonly used due to the broader meaning of BIC. The SWIFT Code is approved by the SWIFT organization and ISO standards.

for_embeddings: Can you explain what a SWIFT Code is and what it's used for in banking?
content: Can you explain what a SWIFT Code is and what it's used for in banking? --- A SWIFT Code, also known as a Bank Identifier Code (BIC), is a unique code that identifies specific banks and financial institutions when conducting international financial transactions. Think of it as a bank's international "ID number." While it was originally called a BIC, the term SWIFT Code is now more commonly used due to the broader scope of what a BIC can represent. SWIFT Codes are standardized and approved by the SWIFT organization and ISO standards.

for_embeddings: What exactly is a SWIFT Code, and why is it important for international money transfers?
content: What exactly is a SWIFT Code, and why is it important for international money transfers? --- A SWIFT Code (which also goes by Bank Identifier Code or BIC) is a unique identification code used to identify specific banks and financial institutions during international financial transactions. It essentially acts as a bank's international "address" or "ID number." Although the initial term was BIC, SWIFT Code is more widely used today because BIC's meaning has expanded. These codes are officially recognized by the SWIFT organization and adhere to ISO standards.

for_embeddings: What should I expect when my withdrawal status is 'pending' on the BeeMarkets platform?
content: What should I expect when my withdrawal status is 'pending' on the BeeMarkets platform? --- A 'pending' withdrawal status means that your request has been received and is currently in the queue for processing. for_embeddings: What should I do if the card I used to fund my account is closed, lost, stolen or not available for withdrawal?
content: What should I do if the card I used to fund my account is closed, lost, stolen or not available for withdrawal? --- You can delete the original bank card and add a new valid card under your name in the Client Portal before submitting a withdrawal request.

for_embeddings: The bank card I used for deposits is now closed/lost/stolen/unavailable for withdrawals. How can I withdraw my funds from BeeMarkets?
content: The bank card I used for deposits is now closed/lost/stolen/unavailable for withdrawals. How can I withdraw my funds from BeeMarkets? --- If the bank card you used for funding is no longer available for withdrawals, you can delete the original card within the Client Portal and then add a new valid bank card that is registered under your name. Once the new card is added, you can submit your withdrawal request using this new card.

for_embeddings: What steps should I take if the bank card I initially used to deposit funds is now closed, lost, stolen, or I can't use it for withdrawals?
content: What steps should I take if the bank card I initially used to deposit funds is now closed, lost, stolen, or I can't use it for withdrawals? --- In this situation, you should first remove the original bank card from your Client Portal. Then, you can add a new, valid bank card that is registered in your name. After successfully adding the new card, you will be able to submit your withdrawal request using this new payment method.

for_embeddings: My original funding card is no longer valid for withdrawals (closed, lost, etc.). How do I proceed with withdrawing funds from my BeeMarkets account?
content: My original funding card is no longer valid for withdrawals (closed, lost, etc.). for_embeddings: I can no longer use the bank card I used to deposit funds. How can I withdraw my money from BeeMarkets if the card is closed, lost, or otherwise unavailable?

for_embeddings: What is the procedure if the bank card I used for deposits is now closed, lost, stolen, or I simply cannot use it for withdrawals anymore?

Once the new card is successfully added to your account, you can then proceed to submit your withdrawal request using the new card.

for_embeddings: What personal details I need in my Identification?
content: What personal details I need in my Identification? --- Your ID card must include your full name, date of birth, a clear photo, the document number, issue and/or expiry date, and the name of the issuing authority.

for_embeddings: What personal information do I need to provide?
content: What personal information do I need to provide? --- To be accepted for verification, your ID card should clearly display your full name, date of birth, a recognizable photo, the document number, its expiration date, and the issuing government authority.

for_embeddings: Do I really need to submit personal documents?
content: Do I really need to submit personal documents? --- Yes, accepted identification must contain the following details: your full name, a clear photo, date of birth, unique ID/document number, issue and expiration dates, and the name of the issuing authority. All text should be clearly visible and in Latin characters if possible.

for_embeddings: Why is it required  to submit personal identification for Beemarkets?
content: Why is it required  to submit personal identification for Beemarkets? --- Personal identification is required to comply with international regulations such as KYC (Know Your Customer) and AML (Anti-Money Laundering). These measures help ensure the security of your account and prevent fraud, identity theft, and financial crimes.

for_embeddings: What is the purpose of requesting personal ID documents?
content: What is the purpose of requesting personal ID documents? --- We request ID documents to verify your identity, protect your account, and meet regulatory standards. This helps maintain a secure trading environment for all users.

for_embeddings: Can you clarify why identity verification is required?
content: Can you clarify why identity verification is required? ---  Identity verification helps us confirm that you are the rightful account holder. It also ensures we meet legal obligations and provide you with a secure trading experience.

for_embeddings: Reason for needing to verify my identity with official documents?
content: Reason for needing to verify my identity with official documents? --- Yes, verifying your identity is a legal requirement for regulated financial platforms. It helps prevent unauthorized access and enhances the integrity of our services.

for_embeddings: Why am I required to submit government-issued identification?
content: Why am I required to submit government-issued identification? --- Government-issued ID is the most reliable way to confirm your identity. It ensures compliance with financial laws and helps us safeguard your personal and financial data.

for_embeddings: How does BeeMarkets calculate margin for hedged positions?
content: How does BeeMarkets calculate margin for hedged positions? --- At BeeMarkets, when you open hedged (locked) positions—equal buy and sell trades on the same instrument—the margin requirement is significantly reduced. In most cases, only the margin for one side (usually the larger position) is required.

for_embeddings: margin requirement for locked positions on BeeMarkets?
content: margin requirement for locked positions on BeeMarkets? --- For locked or hedged positions, BeeMarkets generally applies margin only on the leg with the higher volume. The second leg may not require additional margin, depending on market conditions and account type.

for_embeddings: BeeMarkets charge margin on both sides of a hedge?
content: BeeMarkets charge margin on both sides of a hedge? --- No, in a typical hedge setup, margin is only charged for one side of the trade—usually the side with the larger position size.

for_embeddings: Is margin reduced when I open a hedged position on BeeMarkets?
content: Is margin reduced when I open a hedged position on BeeMarkets? --- Yes, hedging reduces your margin exposure. BeeMarkets calculates margin based on the net exposure or the higher-volume side of the position.

for_embeddings: How is margin affected when I lock a position on the platform?
content: How is margin affected when I lock a position on the platform? --- Good question! If you place both buy and sell orders for the same symbol, BeeMarkets only charges margin on one side. So, it helps you free up more margin

for_embeddings: What happens to my margin when I open opposite positions in the same pair?
content: What happens to my margin when I open opposite positions in the same pair? --- When you hedge like that, your required margin goes down. You only need to cover one leg, not both.

for_embeddings: Does hedging reduce my margin usage with BeeMarkets?
content: Does hedging reduce my margin usage with BeeMarkets? --- Yes, hedging definitely reduces your margin usage. That’s one of its advantages—only one position (usually the larger one) counts toward your margin.

for_embeddings: Can you explain how margin works with hedged (locked) trades?
content: Can you explain how margin works with hedged (locked) trades? --- Sure! When you lock in a trade with equal buy and sell positions, BeeMarkets calculates margin only on the higher-volume leg. This reduces your overall margin requirement.

for_embeddings: Do I need full margin for both buy and sell orders in a hedge?
content: Do I need full margin for both buy and sell orders in a hedge? --- No, you don’t. In most cases, BeeMarkets only requires margin for the side with the larger trade size, not both.

for_embeddings: policy does BeeMarkets follow for opposite positions in the same instrument?
content: policy does BeeMarkets follow for opposite positions in the same instrument? --- Our policy is to apply margin on one side of a hedged position. If you’re holding opposite trades in the same asset, your margin will be reduced accordingly.

for_embeddings: What is the margin calculation method for hedged positions on BeeMarkets accounts?
content: What is the margin calculation method for hedged positions on BeeMarkets accounts? --- BeeMarkets uses a net exposure method for hedged positions. If you hold equal buy and sell trades, your margin is based on the larger position, helping you use your capital more efficiently.

for_embeddings: How does margin differ between standard and hedged trades on BeeMarkets?
content: How does margin differ between standard and hedged trades on BeeMarkets? --- Standard trades require full margin based on the trade size, while hedged trades require margin only on one side. This makes hedging an effective strategy for managing margin risk.

for_embeddings: I want to reduce margin exposure by locking positions?
content: I want to reduce margin exposure by locking positions?  --- Yes, locking positions (also called hedging) reduces margin exposure. BeeMarkets calculates the margin based only on the larger side of the position, helping traders optimize account leverage.

for_embeddings: What’s the difference between a trading password and a read-only password?
content: What’s the difference between a trading password and a read-only password? --- The trading password allows full access to your account, including placing trades, modifying orders, and managing funds. The read-only password provides view-only access — perfect for monitoring the account without making any changes.

for_embeddings: How does a read-only password differ from a trading password?
content: How does a read-only password differ from a trading password? --- A read-only password lets someone view your trading activity, balance, and charts without being able to place or close trades. The trading password, on the other hand, grants full control over trading operations.

for_embeddings: purpose of a read-only password compared to a trading password?
content: purpose of a read-only password compared to a trading password? --- The read-only password is mainly used to share account performance or analysis with others safely, without risking unauthorized trading. The trading password should be kept private and secure at all times.

for_embeddings: What are the functions of a trading password versus a read-only password?
content:
What are the functions of a trading password versus a read-only password? --- Trading Password: Full access (place/edit trades, withdraw funds)

Read-Only Password: Limited access (view charts, balance, history — no trading or editing)

for_embeddings: Why are there two types of passwords for the trading platform?
content: Why are there two types of passwords for the trading platform? --- Having two passwords enhances security and flexibility. The read-only password is useful for account monitoring, external audits, or sharing data with mentors or third-party tools without giving full access.

for_embeddings: What are the margin call and stop-out levels at BeeMarkets?
content: What are the margin call and stop-out levels at BeeMarkets? --- At BeeMarkets, the margin call level is 100%, and the stop-out level is 50%. This means you will receive a margin warning when your margin level drops to 100%, and positions may start closing automatically at 50% to protect your account from going into negative balance.

for_embeddings: At what percentage does BeeMarkets trigger a margin call?
content: At what percentage does BeeMarkets trigger a margin call? --- BeeMarkets issues a margin call when your margin level falls to 100%, notifying you that your account is at risk and you may need to add more funds or close positions.

for_embeddings: What is the stop-out level set by BeeMarkets?
content: What is the stop-out level set by BeeMarkets? --- The stop-out level is set at 50%, which means that if your margin level falls to this threshold, the system will begin automatically closing open positions, starting with the most unprofitable ones.

for_embeddings: When does BeeMarkets issue a margin call or stop-out?
content: When does BeeMarkets issue a margin call or stop-out? --- A margin call is issued at 100% margin level, and stop-out occurs at 50%. This is to prevent further losses if your account equity drops too low compared to your used margin.

for_embeddings: How does BeeMarkets define margin call and stop-out levels?
content: How does BeeMarkets define margin call and stop-out levels? --- The margin call level (100%) is a warning point where your account needs attention. The stop-out level (50%) is when the platform starts liquidating positions to maintain balance.

for_embeddings: margin call and stop-out percentages for my account?
content: margin call and stop-out percentages for my account? --- Sure! At BeeMarkets, the margin call is at 100% and the stop-out is at 50%. If your margin level hits 100%, you’ll get a warning. If it drops to 50%, we’ll begin closing positions automatically to protect your account.

for_embeddings: margin level drops too low on BeeMarkets?
content: margin level drops too low on BeeMarkets? --- If it falls to 100%, you’ll get a margin call alert. If it goes all the way down to 50%, the platform will start closing your trades automatically — starting with the ones losing the most.

for_embeddings: BeeMarkets start closing my trades automatically?
content: BeeMarkets start closing my trades automatically? --- That would happen at the stop-out level, which is 50%. If your equity drops too far compared to your margin, your trades will be closed to protect your remaining funds.

for_embeddings: how margin call and stop-out levels work on BeeMarkets?
content: how margin call and stop-out levels work on BeeMarkets? --- Yes! The margin call level (100%) is a warning that your account is at risk. If your margin level continues to fall and reaches the stop-out level (50%), BeeMarkets will automatically begin closing open trades to prevent a negative balance.

for_embeddings: What are the exact thresholds for margin call and stop-out at BeeMarkets?
content: What are the exact thresholds for margin call and stop-out at BeeMarkets? --- BeeMarkets sets the margin call at 100% and the stop-out at 50%. These levels help manage trading risk and maintain account integrity during market volatility.

for_embeddings: margin call and stop-out levels vary by account type or leverage on BeeMarkets?
content: margin call and stop-out levels vary by account type or leverage on BeeMarkets? --- No, the margin call and stop-out levels are standard across all account types. However, your leverage settings can impact how quickly you reach those levels based on your open positions.

for_embeddings: What are the differences between Standard and Professional Accounts?
content:
What are the differences between Standard and Professional Accounts? --- The main differences lie in trading conditions, eligibility, and available features.

Standard Account: Designed for all traders with retail protections, fixed leverage, and access to all basic features.

Professional Account: Suited for experienced traders who meet certain eligibility criteria. Offers higher leverage, lower margin requirements, and fewer restrictions but may waive certain retail protections.

for_embeddings: Professional Account differ from a Standard Account at BeeMarkets?
content: Professional Account differ from a Standard Account at BeeMarkets? --- A Professional Account allows for more flexible trading conditions like higher leverage and tighter spreads. However, clients may not benefit from all regulatory protections available to Standard (retail) clients, such as negative balance protection or compensation schemes.

for_embeddings: Can you explain the features of Standard vs. Professional Accounts?
content:
Can you explain the features of Standard vs. Professional Accounts? --- Standard Account:

Lower leverage

Negative balance protection

Margin close-out at 50%

Professional Account:

Higher leverage (subject to qualification)

Reduced margin requirements

No automatic negative balance protection

for_embeddings: Key benefits of a Professional Account compared to a Standard one?
content:
Key benefits of a Professional Account compared to a Standard one? --- Professional Account benefits include:

Higher leverage (up to 1:400 or more depending on regulations)

Lower margin requirements

Custom trading conditions
But note that it may also mean giving up retail client protections such as compensation schemes or standardized risk disclosures.

for_embeddings: Is there a comparison between Standard and Professional account types?
content: Is there a comparison between Standard and Professional account types? --- Yes, we offer a side-by-side comparison of both account types on our website or support center. It includes differences in leverage, risk protection, and eligibility requirements.

for_embeddings: account type is better for experienced traders — Standard or Professional?
content: account type is better for experienced traders — Standard or Professional? --- If you’re an experienced trader looking for higher leverage and more flexibility, the Professional Account might suit you best. However, you’ll need to meet certain criteria to qualify.

for_embeddings: Can you help me choose between a Standard and a Professional account?
content: Can you help me choose between a Standard and a Professional account? --- Sure! The Standard Account is perfect if you want full regulatory protection and straightforward conditions. The Professional Account is ideal if you’re experienced, meet eligibility requirements, and want access to more advanced features like higher leverage.

for_embeddings: What’s the difference between your regular and pro account options?
content: What’s the difference between your regular and pro account options? --- The regular (Standard) account comes with full investor protections and fixed conditions. The Pro account offers advanced features like higher leverage but fewer protections — it's designed for high-volume or experienced traders.

for_embeddings: Are there any trading condition differences between Standard and Professional Accounts?
content:
Are there any trading condition differences between Standard and Professional Accounts? --- 
Yes. Professional accounts typically have higher leverage, lower margin requirements, and access to custom trading terms, while Standard accounts maintain strict regulatory protections.

for_embeddings: Both Standard and Professional Accounts offer the same leverage and spreads?
content: Both Standard and Professional Accounts offer the same leverage and spreads? --- No, leverage is usually higher in a Professional Account, and spreads may be more competitive, depending on your trading volume. Standard Accounts have capped leverage to comply with regulatory standards.

for_embeddings: Eligibility criteria apply to open a Professional Account vs. a Standard one?
content:
Eligibility criteria apply to open a Professional Account vs. a Standard one? --- To qualify for a Professional Account, you typically need to meet at least two of the following:

Have significant trading volume

Hold a financial portfolio above a certain threshold

Have relevant financial sector experience
Standard Accounts are available to all users by default.

for_embeddings: Netting account types available on your platform?
content: Netting account types available on your platform? --- Yes, netting accounts are available upon request or based on platform selection (typically MT5). Please contact support if you'd like to enable this account mode.

Does BeeMarkets offer netting and hedging account options? --- Yes, we offer both.

Netting is typically used by institutional or CFD traders.

Hedging allows you to hold long and short positions simultaneously on the same instrument.
You can choose based on your trading preferences.

for_embeddings: Is the netting system supported on MetaTrader with your accounts?

for_embeddings: Do I need to pay margin for pending orders?
content: Do I need to pay margin for pending orders? --- No, margin is not required for pending orders until they are triggered and become active positions. Margin is only reserved once the order is executed.

for_embeddings: Are pending orders subject to margin requirements?
content: Are pending orders subject to margin requirements? --- Pending orders do not require margin until they are filled. Your margin is calculated based on open positions only, not unfilled (pending) orders.

for_embeddings: Does margin get reserved when I place a pending order?
content: Does margin get reserved when I place a pending order? --- No, your margin is not affected when you place a pending order. Margin is only allocated when the order is triggered and turns into a live trade.

for_embeddings: Is margin held for limit or stop orders before they are triggered?
content: Is margin held for limit or stop orders before they are triggered? --- No. Margin is not held for limit or stop orders before execution. It is only applied when the order is activated and becomes a market position.

for_embeddings: Do pending trades affect my available margin balance?
content: Do pending trades affect my available margin balance? --- Pending orders do not impact your available margin until they are executed. However, you should monitor your margin levels in case the order is triggered and uses your available margin.

for_embeddings: do I need margin for orders that haven’t opened yet?
content: do I need margin for orders that haven’t opened yet? --- Hi! No, margin is only required once your pending order is triggered and becomes a live trade. You’re not charged margin for orders that are just waiting.

for_embeddings: Will my margin be affected if I place a pending order?
content: Will my margin be affected if I place a pending order? --- Not at all — placing a pending order won’t affect your margin until it’s executed. Only open trades use margin.

for_embeddings: Does placing a limit or stop order use any margin?
content: Does placing a limit or stop order use any margin? --- Nope! Margin is only used after the order is filled and turns into an active position.

for_embeddings: Are demo and live accounts on different servers?
content: Are demo and live accounts on different servers? --- Yes, demo and live accounts typically operate on separate servers. Make sure you select the correct server when logging in.

for_embeddings: How do I select the correct server in MetaTrader?
content: How do I select the correct server in MetaTrader? --- In the MT4/MT5 login window, click on “Add New Broker,” search for “BeeMarkets,” and select the server that matches your account type.

for_embeddings: Can I see the server name in the trading app?
content: Can I see the server name in the trading app? --- Yes, on platforms like MT4/MT5 mobile, the server name is displayed under your account profile after login.

for_embeddings: Will my trading performance be affected by the server I’m on?
content: Will my trading performance be affected by the server I’m on? --- Server selection affects connectivity and execution speed, so always use the server assigned to your account for the best performance.

for_embeddings: Can I change my trading server?
content: Can I change my trading server? --- No, servers are assigned based on your account type and region. If you experience issues, contact support for assistance.

for_embeddings: Does BeeMarkets offer any IB or affiliate programs?
content: Does BeeMarkets offer any IB or affiliate programs? --- Yes, BeeMarkets offers both Introducing Broker (IB) and affiliate programs for individuals and businesses looking to refer clients and earn commissions.

for_embeddings: What is the BeeMarkets Introducing Broker (IB) program
content:
What is the BeeMarkets Introducing Broker (IB) program
 --- The IB program allows you to refer traders to BeeMarkets and earn a commission based on their trading activity.

for_embeddings: How does the affiliate program differ from the IB program?
content: How does the affiliate program differ from the IB program? --- he affiliate program is primarily online and marketing-focused, while the IB program is designed for those offering direct referrals or local client support.

for_embeddings: How can I join the BeeMarkets IB or affiliate program?
content: How can I join the BeeMarkets IB or affiliate program? --- You can apply directly on the BeeMarkets website under the “Partnerships” section. Once approved, you’ll receive a referral link and access to tracking tools.

for_embeddings: Are there any requirements to become an IB or affiliate?
content: Are there any requirements to become an IB or affiliate? --- Yes, applicants must comply with BeeMarkets’ terms and may need to provide verification or meet referral performance thresholds.

for_embeddings: What kind of commissions can I earn as an IB or affiliate?
content: What kind of commissions can I earn as an IB or affiliate? --- Commissions vary based on the referred clients’ trading volume and account type. Tiered and performance-based rewards are available.

for_embeddings: How are commissions tracked and paid?
content: How are commissions tracked and paid? --- Commissions are tracked in real time via your partner dashboard and typically paid out monthly or as agreed upon in your partner terms.

for_embeddings: Can I promote BeeMarkets in any country as an affiliate?
content: Can I promote BeeMarkets in any country as an affiliate? --- Promotions are subject to local regulations. Please check with BeeMarkets or your account manager regarding restricted regions.

for_embeddings: Does BeeMarkets provide marketing materials for affiliates?
content: Does BeeMarkets provide marketing materials for affiliates? --- Yes, affiliates have access to a library of banners, landing pages, and tracking tools to support promotional efforts.

for_embeddings: Who do I contact for questions about the IB or affiliate program?
content: Who do I contact for questions about the IB or affiliate program? --- You can reach out to the BeeMarkets Partnership Team via the contact form or live chat on the official website.

for_embeddings: Which countries are restricted from accessing BeeMarkets?
content: Which countries are restricted from accessing BeeMarkets? --- BeeMarkets does not provide services to residents of certain countries due to regulatory restrictions. These include the U.S.,Mainland China North Korea, Iran, and others listed on our restricted jurisdictions page.

for_embeddings: Can users from the United States open an account with BeeMarkets?
content: Can users from the United States open an account with BeeMarkets? --- No, BeeMarkets does not accept clients from the U.S. due to regulatory limitations.

for_embeddings: Why are some countries restricted from using BeeMarkets?
content: Why are some countries restricted from using BeeMarkets? ---  Restrictions are based on international laws, financial regulations, and sanctions to ensure compliance with legal obligations.

for_embeddings: Is my country allowed to trade with BeeMarkets?
content: Is my country allowed to trade with BeeMarkets? --- You can check the full list of supported and restricted countries on our website or during the account registration process.

for_embeddings: What happens if I try to open an account from a restricted country?
content: What happens if I try to open an account from a restricted country? --- Your account may be declined or disabled if it’s determined you reside in a restricted jurisdiction.

for_embeddings: Do you have an office in Dubai?
content: Do you have an office in Dubai? --- Yes, BeeMarkets maintains a representative office in Dubai to support clients in the Middle East region.

for_embeddings: Where is the BeeMarkets Dubai office located?
content: Where is the BeeMarkets Dubai office located? ---  The specific address of our Dubai office can be found on our Contact Us page or by reaching out to customer support.

for_embeddings: an I visit the BeeMarkets office in Dubai in person?
content: an I visit the BeeMarkets office in Dubai in person? --- Visits are by appointment only. Please contact our support team to schedule a meeting with a representative.

for_embeddings: What services are offered at the Dubai office?
content: What services are offered at the Dubai office? --- Our Dubai office provides client support, account setup assistance, and partnership inquiries for the region

for_embeddings: Does the Dubai office handle customer support?
content: Does the Dubai office handle customer support? --- Yes, regional support is available through the Dubai office during local business hours

for_embeddings: How can I submit feedback or a complaint to BeeMarkets?
content: How can I submit feedback or a complaint to BeeMarkets? --- You can submit feedback or a complaint by filling out the contact form on our website or emailing our support team at [support@beemarkets.com].

for_embeddings: Is there a dedicated channel for complaints?
content: Is there a dedicated channel for complaints? --- Yes, formal complaints can be submitted to our compliance team via the “Complaints” section in your client portal.

for_embeddings: What information should I include in a complaint?
content: What information should I include in a complaint? --- Please include your full name, account number, a clear description of the issue, and any supporting evidence or screenshots.

for_embeddings: How long does it take BeeMarkets to respond to a complaint?
content: How long does it take BeeMarkets to respond to a complaint? --- We aim to acknowledge all complaints within 24 hours and provide a resolution within 5–7 business days.

for_embeddings: Can I track the status of my complaint?
content: Can I track the status of my complaint? --- Yes, after submission, you will receive a case reference number which you can use to follow up with our support team.

for_embeddings: What are the customer support hours at BeeMarkets?
content: What are the customer support hours at BeeMarkets? --- BeeMarkets’ customer support is available 24 hours a day, 5 days a week — from Monday to Friday.

for_embeddings: Is customer support available on weekends?
content: Is customer support available on weekends? --- Support is generally unavailable on weekends. However, urgent issues may be addressed via email depending on the nature of the inquiry.

for_embeddings: What are the live chat support hours?
content: What are the live chat support hours? ---  Live chat is available 24/5, from Monday 00:00 to Friday 23:59 (platform time).

for_embeddings: When is phone support available at BeeMarkets?
content: When is phone support available at BeeMarkets? --- Phone support is open during standard business hours, Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM (local office time).

for_embeddings: Can I get support during holidays?
content: Can I get support during holidays? --- Support may be limited during public holidays. Please check our holiday schedule on the website for specific dates.

for_embeddings: How can I find out about BeeMarkets’ bonuses or promotional activities?
content: How can I find out about BeeMarkets’ bonuses or promotional activities? --- You can view our latest bonuses and promotions by visiting the “Promotions” section on our website or by subscribing to our newsletter.

for_embeddings: Does BeeMarkets currently offer any welcome bonuses?
content: Does BeeMarkets currently offer any welcome bonuses? --- From time to time, BeeMarkets offers welcome bonuses. Check our promotions page or contact support for current offers.

for_embeddings: Are promotional offers available to all clients?
content: Are promotional offers available to all clients? --- Most promotions are available to eligible new and existing clients, but some may be region-specific or subject to conditions.

for_embeddings: How will I be notified about upcoming promotions?
content: How will I be notified about upcoming promotions? --- You’ll receive updates via email, in-platform notifications, and on our official social media channels.

for_embeddings: Where is the promotions page on BeeMarkets’ website?
content: Where is the promotions page on BeeMarkets’ website? --- You can find it under the “About” or “Promotions” tab on our homepage.

for_embeddings: BeeMarkets currently does not have trading community.
content: BeeMarkets currently does not have trading community. --- BeeMarkets currently does not have trading community.

for_embeddings: Can I join a forum or group chat for BeeMarkets traders?
content: Can I join a forum or group chat for BeeMarkets traders? --- At this time, we do not operate any official forums or group chats. All updates and insights are provided through our official communication channels.

for_embeddings: Are there any social or community features available to BeeMarkets users?
content: Are there any social or community features available to BeeMarkets users? --- While we do not offer community features right now, we encourage users to stay connected via our educational webinars and newsletters.

for_embeddings: Is BeeMarkets planning to launch a trading community?
content: Is BeeMarkets planning to launch a trading community? --- A trading community is under consideration for future development. We value your feedback and may introduce such features based on user demand.

for_embeddings: Where can I interact with other BeeMarkets clients?
content: Where can I interact with other BeeMarkets clients? --- Currently, there is no platform for peer interaction. For any support or education needs, our team is available 24/5 to assist you directly.

for_embeddings: What is a market gap?
content: What is a market gap? --- A market gap occurs when the price of a financial instrument suddenly jumps from one level to another without any trades happening in between. This typically happens during periods of low trading activity, such as when markets reopen after being closed (like over the weekend) or during major news announcements.

for_embeddings: Which currencies can I use to make a deposit with BeeMarkets?
content: Which currencies can I use to make a deposit with BeeMarkets? --- BeeMarkets accepts deposits in several major currencies, including USD, EUR, GBP, and others depending on your payment method and region.

for_embeddings: Can I deposit funds in my local currency?
content: Can I deposit funds in my local currency? --- In many cases, yes. BeeMarkets supports multiple local currencies through various payment providers. However, currency conversion fees may apply.

for_embeddings: What is the base currency of my account, and does it affect my deposit?
content: What is the base currency of my account, and does it affect my deposit? ---  Your account's base currency determines how your deposit is reflected. Deposits in other currencies will be automatically converted at the prevailing rate.

for_embeddings: Are cryptocurrency deposits supported?
content: Are cryptocurrency deposits supported? --- Yes, BeeMarkets accepts selected cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and USDT. Check the deposit section for available crypto options.

for_embeddings: Where can I find the full list of accepted deposit currencies?
content: Where can I find the full list of accepted deposit currencies? --- You can view all available deposit currencies in your client portal under the “Deposit” section or contact support for region-specific options.

for_embeddings: Why is the amount received in my BeeMarkets account less than what I wired?
content: Why is the amount received in my BeeMarkets account less than what I wired? --- This may be due to intermediary or receiving bank fees applied during the wire transfer process. BeeMarkets does not charge a fee for incoming wires, but third-party banks involved may deduct fees before the funds reach your account.

for_embeddings: I sent $1,000 but only received $970 in my trading account. Why?
content: I sent $1,000 but only received $970 in my trading account. Why? --- The difference is likely due to wire transfer charges imposed by correspondent or intermediary banks, which are beyond BeeMarkets' control.

for_embeddings: Does BeeMarkets deduct any fees from wire deposits?
content: Does BeeMarkets deduct any fees from wire deposits? --- No, BeeMarkets does not charge for wire deposits. However, your bank or intermediary banks may apply processing fees that reduce the final credited amount.

for_embeddings: How can I avoid receiving less than I sent via wire transfer?
content: How can I avoid receiving less than I sent via wire transfer? --- You may contact your bank in advance to inquire about any outgoing or intermediary bank fees. Using local payment options or e-wallets (if available) may also reduce or eliminate such charges.

for_embeddings: Can I get a breakdown of where the missing funds went?
content: Can I get a breakdown of where the missing funds went? --- You may request a transaction trace (MT103 form) from your bank, which shows each step and any fees deducted by intermediary institutions.

for_embeddings: Can I make a deposit from someone else’s bank or card account?
content: Can I make a deposit from someone else’s bank or card account? --- No. BeeMarkets strictly prohibits third-party deposits. The funding source must be in the same name as the trading account holder.

for_embeddings: Can I withdraw funds to an account that’s not in my name?
content: Can I withdraw funds to an account that’s not in my name? --- No. For security and compliance reasons, withdrawals can only be processed to accounts owned by the verified account holder.

for_embeddings: Why doesn’t BeeMarkets allow third-party transactions?
content: Why doesn’t BeeMarkets allow third-party transactions? --- To comply with international anti-money laundering (AML) and fraud prevention regulations, BeeMarkets does not accept or process any third-party deposits or withdrawals.

for_embeddings: What happens if I accidentally deposit from a third-party account?
content: What happens if I accidentally deposit from a third-party account? --- The funds may be returned to the original source, and your account may be temporarily restricted until the issue is resolved. Please contact support immediately.

for_embeddings: Can a friend or family member fund my account on my behalf?
content: Can a friend or family member fund my account on my behalf? --- No. All deposits and withdrawals must originate from and be sent to accounts registered in your own name only.

for_embeddings: How long does it take for my deposit to appear in my BeeMarkets account?
content: How long does it take for my deposit to appear in my BeeMarkets account? --- Deposit times vary by payment method. Most e-wallet and card deposits are processed instantly, while bank wire transfers can take 1–5 business days.

for_embeddings: Why hasn’t my deposit appeared yet?
content: Why hasn’t my deposit appeared yet? ---  Delays may occur due to processing times at your bank, incorrect details, or pending verification. Please allow the expected timeframe and contact support with your transaction ID if it still doesn’t appear.

for_embeddings: Are deposits processed on weekends or holidays?
content: Are deposits processed on weekends or holidays? --- Deposits made via cards or e-wallets may be processed on weekends, but bank transfers are only processed on business days.

for_embeddings: What payment methods offer the fastest deposit times?
content: What payment methods offer the fastest deposit times? --- E-wallets and credit/debit cards typically provide instant or near-instant deposits, depending on your location and provider.

for_embeddings: How can I track the status of my deposit?
content: How can I track the status of my deposit? --- You can view your deposit status in your BeeMarkets client portal under the “Transaction History” section or contact our support team for assistance.

for_embeddings: What should I do if the credit card I used to deposit has expired?
content: What should I do if the credit card I used to deposit has expired? --- If your previous card has expired, please inform our support team before requesting a withdrawal. You may need to provide updated payment details or verify a new card.

for_embeddings: Can I withdraw funds to a new card if my original card is expired?
content: Can I withdraw funds to a new card if my original card is expired? --- Withdrawals must typically be made back to the original deposit method. If your card has expired, please contact support to arrange an alternative, verified withdrawal method.

for_embeddings: Will my expired card affect my ability to access funds?
content: Will my expired card affect my ability to access funds? ---  Your funds remain safe. However, to process withdrawals, you must update your payment method and verify your new card or bank details with our compliance team.

for_embeddings: How do I update my card information on BeeMarkets?
content: How do I update my card information on BeeMarkets? --- You can upload your new card details securely through the client portal or contact our support team for assistance with updating your withdrawal method.

for_embeddings: What documents are needed if my card has expired?
content: What documents are needed if my card has expired? --- You may be asked to provide a copy of your new card (with only the last 4 digits visible), proof of identity, and possibly a bank statement showing your name and account number.
